result.arabic_text: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
result.translation: He felt apprehensive about them[7]. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.
result.footnotes: [7] In their culture, if a guest refused to eat the food provided, it was considered a sign of ill will. See footnote 11:70.
